str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and a probable derivative of kuon; to fawn or crouch to, i.e. prostrate oneself in homage.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From the same as makrothumos; to be long-spirited, i.e. forbearing or patient.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
